result.name: ni_157c_processing_of_planning_applications_as_measured_against_targets_for_other_application_types
result.notes:
This indicator measures the percentage of planning applications dealt with in a timely manner: major, minor and other. All local planning authorities except county councils should use CLG form PS2 for supplying information on the planning applications determined. A timely manner is defined as within 13 weeks for Major applications and within 8 weeks for Minor and Other applications. Subject to the outcome of the recent consultation paper applications that are part of a Planning Performance Agreement and the timetable agreed with developers is adhered to will be excluded from the calculations.
Source: Communities and Local Government (CLG)
Publisher: DCLG Floor Targets Interactive
Geographies: Local Authority District (LAD), County/Unitary Authority, Government Office Region (GOR), National
Geographic coverage: England
Time coverage: 2006 to 2009/10
Type of data: Administrative data

odi-certificate.title: NI 157c Processing of planning applications as measured against targets for other application types
